section.name: name
section.description: nw - a private network management service

section.name: description
section.description: The "nw" CLI allows you to manage private network manipulation, such as allocation, resizing, and listing of currently allocated CIDR ranges. The service guarantees that allocated CIDR ranges do not overlap to help avoid conflicts.

command.name: ls
command.description: The "ls" command allows you to list allocated or free CIDR ranges.

command.name: allocate
command.description: The "allocate" command allows you reserve a deconflicted CIDR ranges.

section.name: name
section.description: nw ls - list allocated or free CIDR ranges.

section.name: description
section.description: The "ls" command allows you to peek at allocated or free CIDR ranges.

option.name: -fp
option.description: Lists free CIDR ranges with a given prefix.

section.name: name
section.description: nw allocate - reserve a CIDR range.

section.name: description
section.description: The "allocate" command allows you to reserve a free CIDR range.
